Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery bowl with slightly flaring sides and everted rim, the fabric is relatively coarse and pink in section, the outer surface is covered with a red-brown slip, there is a line of incised Coptic text around the exterior.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell & J. Faiers
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394297) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394297)
